description: Event value analysis - which events are worth your time/money and how to prepare

free.label: Free
free.description: Full rewards achievable through normal gameplay

medium_spend.label: Medium Spend ($20-50)
medium_spend.description: Moderate spending needed for good rewards

S.label: Must Do
S.description: High value rewards for effort/cost. Never skip.

C.label: Low Priority
C.description: Skip unless you have excess resources.

bear_trap.name: Bear Trap
bear_trap.description: Alliance rallies against Raging Bear. Damage-based rewards.
bear_trap.gameplay: A giant bear spawns near your alliance territory. Your alliance takes turns launching 5-hero rallies against it. You select your best exploration heroes (NOT expedition) and join the rally. The bear has massive HP and fights back, so you need a healer like Philly. Your damage dealt earns points for rewards. Coordinate with alliance to maximize rally efficiency.

tips: Use exploration skills team, NOT expedition
Coordinate rally timing with alliance
Healer (Philly) is critical for sustain

troop_ratio.reasoning: Maximum DPS focus. Bear doesn't kill troops quickly, so you want damage output. Marksman deals highest damage from back row.

bear_trap.notes: One of the best F2P events. Always participate.

crazy_joe.name: Crazy Joe
crazy_joe.description: 21 waves of bandit attacks on your alliance. Coordinate defense for maximum points.
crazy_joe.gameplay: Crazy Joe attacks your alliance in 21 waves! Send your troops to reinforce alliance members' cities. When their city gets attacked, your troops defend and earn points based on kills. Waves 10 and 20 target ONLY the Alliance HQ. Waves 7, 14, 17 target ONLY online players (double points!). Waves 17-19 give ~31% of total points. Coordinate with alliance to maximize kill distribution.

tips: Use EXPEDITION skills (not exploration) - this is defense combat
Don't heal troops mid-event - healed troops stay in your city and steal kills from reinforcers
Reinforce ONLINE players - they get hit more often (waves 7, 14, 17) = more points for your troops
After wave 10, recall troops from HQ and go back to reinforcing cities

wave_mechanics.wave_10: Targets ONLY Alliance HQ - recall troops and send to HQ after wave 9
wave_mechanics.wave_20: Targets ONLY Alliance HQ - recall troops and send to HQ after wave 19
wave_mechanics.online_waves: Waves 7, 14, 17 target ONLY online players - double points!
wave_mechanics.high_value_waves: Waves 17-19 give ~31% of total points - be ready

troop_ratio.reasoning: Infantry engage first in combat. With enough stats/numbers, they kill all bandits before Lancers or Marksman can attack. Same ratio for both city defense and HQ waves.

crazy_joe.notes: High-value F2P event. Coordinate with alliance. If a city loses 2 waves, it stops generating points - prioritize defending weaker members.

svs_prep.name: SvS Preparation Phase
svs_prep.description: 5 days of daily tasks earning points. Winning state gets attack advantage in Battle Phase.
svs_prep.gameplay: Your entire state competes against another state by earning points. Each day has different point-earning activities (Day 1: building/research, Day 2: heroes, Day 3: beasts, etc.). You do normal gameplay but DURING the right day to earn points. Save your speedups, shards, and materials beforehand, then spend them on the matching day. Your state's total points vs theirs determines who attacks in the battle phase.

day_2_basic_skills.name: Day 2: Basic Skills Up
day_2_basic_skills.note: General Shards do NOT count - only specific hero shards

day_3_beast_slay.name: Day 3: Beast Slay
day_3_beast_slay.note: NO SPEEDUP POINTS on Day 3! Coordinate Polar Terror rallies with alliance.

day_4_hero_development.name: Day 4: Hero Development / Training

efficiency_analysis.description: Should you use speedups to train more troops, or save them for Day 1/2/5?
efficiency_analysis.conclusion: PROMOTE existing troops (better than speedups). T9→T10 is best. Don't train NEW troops with speedups.
optimal_strategy: 2nd: Promote T8→T9 (0.64 p/s) - still beats speedups
Save speedups for Day 1/2/5 instead of training new troops
Training new T10 directly (0.39 p/s) is worse than speedup points
Don't bother promoting lower tiers (T7 and below) - poor value

day_4_hero_development.note: NO SPEEDUP POINTS on Day 4! T9→T10 promotion (0.71 p/s) is BEST, beats speedups. T8→T9 also good. Training NEW troops loses to speedups.

save_before: ALL Speedups (Day 1, 2, 5 only - NOT Day 3 or 4!)
tips: SPEEDUPS ONLY GIVE POINTS ON DAY 1, 2, AND 5 - not Day 3 or 4!
General Hero Shards do NOT give points - only named hero shards count!
Day 4: T9→T10 promotion is BEST (0.71 p/s), beats speedup value (0.50 p/s)
Day 4: T8→T9 also great (0.64 p/s). Lower tiers are poor value.
Day 4: Training NEW troops (0.39 p/s) loses to speedups - save speedups for Day 5
Wait for President buffs before using resources
Coordinate Polar Terror rallies on Day 3
Save Mithril specifically for Day 4 - 40,000 points each!
Building upgrades just need to START on that day - don't need to finish

svs_prep.notes: Prep phase is as important as battle. Winning prep = attack advantage + healing buffs in battle.

svs_battle.name: SvS Battle Phase
svs_battle.description: Cross-state PvP combat. Capture Sunfire Castle to win.
svs_battle.gameplay: Portals open to the enemy state! You teleport to their territory and attack enemy cities, or stay home and defend yours. The main goal is capturing Sunfire Castle in the center and holding it. Your alliance coordinates rallies on enemy cities and the castle. When attacked, your heroes and troops defend. Killing enemies and holding the castle earns points. Troop losses are partially recovered after the battle ends.

mechanics.attack_range: Can only attack within ±3 Furnace levels
mechanics.win_condition: Hold Sunfire Castle for 2.5 hours consecutively
mechanics.troop_revival: Field Triage phase after - 30-90% troop recovery

tips: EXPEDITION skills matter, not exploration
Jessie or Jeronimo in leftmost slot for attack rallies
Sergey in leftmost slot for garrison defense
Bookmark weak targets before battle starts
Keep shield up when not actively fighting
Defense is as important as offense
Reinforce allies even if low power
Coordinate rally timing with R4/R5

svs_battle.notes: Prep phase winner attacks. Organized states beat higher power disorganized states.

alliance_showdown.name: Alliance Showdown
alliance_showdown.gameplay: Your alliance is matched against another alliance for a 2-hour battle. You're teleported to a special battlefield map. Capture buildings and flags to earn points, and attack enemy players who get in your way. It's real-time chaos - you need to be online and coordinating with your alliance. March speed and quick reactions matter. The alliance with more points at the end wins.

tips: Must be online during the event window
Coordinate with alliance leadership
Defense is as important as offense

alliance_showdown.notes: Good rewards but requires being online at specific time.

hall_of_chiefs.name: Hall of Chiefs
hall_of_chiefs.description: Month-long power competition. Points from upgrades, training, research.
hall_of_chiefs.gameplay: A week-long competition where everything you upgrade earns points. Complete buildings, finish research, train troops, level heroes - all of it counts. You're ranked against other players in your state and across states. The key is SAVING all your speedups and materials beforehand, then dumping everything during this event. Top rankers get massive rewards including legendary hero shards.

tips: SAVE ALL SPEEDUPS for this event
Queue expensive upgrades beforehand
Coordinate with alliance for territory bonuses
Points come from completing upgrades during event

hall_of_chiefs.notes: Best rewards in game but competitive. F2P can rank well by saving speedups.

king_of_icefield.name: King of Icefield
king_of_icefield.gameplay: Your state battles another for control of territory tiles on a shared map. You march your troops to capture empty tiles or attack enemy-held tiles. Holding tiles generates points over time. Alliances coordinate to hold clusters of tiles. It's a 48-hour tug-of-war where being online and quick to respond to attacks matters. Think of it as a slower, strategic SvS focused on map control rather than city burning.

tips: March speed matters
Coordinate timing with alliance
Control points = sustained rewards

king_of_icefield.notes: Good alternative to SvS weeks. Territory control rewards active alliances.

snowbusters.name: Snowbusters
snowbusters.description: Mini-game: Drive snowplow, collect coal, rescue survivors.
snowbusters.gameplay: A mini-game where you drive a snowplow through a snowy map. Use fuel to move and clear snow, collecting coal and rescuing survivors along the way. Clearing sections earns rewards. The catch? Fuel regenerates slowly, and you hit a wall fast without buying fuel packs. Fun but pay-to-progress. F2P players should just do the free daily attempts and not stress about it.

tips: FREE players hit a wall quickly
Packs required to progress past early stages
Rewards are mostly cosmetic + small resources
Skip if F2P or light spender

snowbusters.notes: FUN but PAY-TO-PROGRESS. F2P should skip or just do free attempts.

fishing_tournament.name: Fishing Tournament
fishing_tournament.description: Catch fish for points. Bait costs resources or money.
fishing_tournament.gameplay: Cast your line into an ice fishing hole and wait for fish to bite. You spend bait items to fish - each cast might catch common junk or rare valuable fish. Different fish are worth different points. You rank against other players based on total points. The problem? Bait regenerates slowly for free, and you hit a wall fast. Buying bait packs lets you fish more, but the rewards rarely justify the cost. Just do your free casts and move on.

tips: Bait is the bottleneck
Free bait = minimal rewards
Not worth spending money on
Do free attempts only

fishing_tournament.notes: Poor value. Do free attempts only. Don't buy bait packs.

lucky_wheel.name: Lucky Wheel
lucky_wheel.description: Spin for hero shards. Main way to get new legendary heroes.
lucky_wheel.gameplay: A gacha wheel featuring a specific hero. You spend gems (1,350 per spin, or 13,500 for 10 spins) or free tickets to spin. Each spin gives random rewards - mostly small stuff, but you have a chance at the featured hero's shards. Reaching spin milestones guarantees shards. This is THE main way to unlock new legendary heroes. Be selective - only spin for heroes worth building.

tips: ONLY spin for heroes you actually need
Check hero tier before investing
Save tickets/gems for featured S+ heroes
10-spin is more efficient than singles

lucky_wheel.notes: Primary hero acquisition method. Be selective - don't spin for every hero.

artisans_trove.name: Artisan's Trove
artisans_trove.description: Craft chief gear and charms at discount during event.
artisans_trove.gameplay: The blacksmith offers bonus rewards when you craft chief gear! Spend your saved gear materials (Hardened Alloy, Design Plans, etc.) to craft or upgrade chief gear. You get the normal gear PLUS bonus rewards like speedups and resources. Never craft gear outside this event - always wait for Artisan's Trove to get the free bonuses.

tips: SAVE all gear crafting for this event
Bonus rewards for crafting during event
Focus on one gear set at a time

artisans_trove.notes: Best time to craft gear. Save materials and craft during event only.

tundra_trading.name: Tundra Trading Station
tundra_trading.description: Trade resources at special exchange rates.
tundra_trading.gameplay: A traveling merchant arrives with special exchange rates! You can trade resources you have excess of (like meat or wood) for resources you need (like iron or coal). Check the exchange rates carefully - some trades are good value, others aren't. Good for balancing your resource stockpile. Quick event, just check once, do your trades, done.

tips: Good for converting excess resources
Check exchange rates before trading
Don't trade resources you actually need

tundra_trading.notes: Useful for resource balancing. Free value.

flame_lotto.name: Flame Lotto
flame_lotto.gameplay: A lottery wheel where you spend Flame currency to spin. Each spin gives random rewards - speedups, resources, hero shards, or even rare items. You accumulate Flames from various activities throughout the week. The KEY rule: NEVER spend Flames outside this event! Hoard every single Flame you earn, then dump them all during Flame Lotto for maximum spins and milestone rewards.

backpack_items: Varies - can include legendary shards, speedups, rare materials

save_before: ALL flames - don't spend between events
tips: NEVER spend flames outside this event
Save all flames for Flame Lotto
Best value for flame currency

flame_lotto.notes: Save ALL flames for this event. Best flame value.

mix_and_match.name: Mix and Match
mix_and_match.description: Purchase packs to unlock matching rewards.
mix_and_match.gameplay: A spending event where buying packs unlocks bonus rewards. The more packs you buy of a certain type (like FC packs or Steel packs), the more bonus materials you unlock. Think of it as a 'buy 5 get 1 free' deal. Only worthwhile if you were already planning to buy packs - don't let this event trick you into spending money you weren't going to spend anyway.

backpack_items: Depends on pack type - FC, Steel, etc.

tips: Only worth it if you were buying packs anyway
Focus on ONE material type for best bonuses
Don't buy packs JUST for this event

mix_and_match.notes: Good if you're already spending. Don't spend BECAUSE of this event.

treasure_hunter.name: Treasure Hunter
treasure_hunter.description: Complete tasks to dig for treasure rewards.
treasure_hunter.gameplay: Complete daily tasks to earn shovels, then dig for buried treasure on a grid. Each dig reveals either a reward or nothing. Some tiles have better loot than others. It's basically a mini-game that rewards you for normal gameplay - complete your dailies, get shovels, dig for free stuff. No special strategy needed, just participate.

tips: Complete daily tasks to earn digs
Free rewards for normal gameplay
No special preparation needed

treasure_hunter.notes: Free rewards for playing normally. Always participate.

canyon_clash.name: Canyon Clash
canyon_clash.description: Alliance territory battle in canyon map.
canyon_clash.gameplay: Your alliance fights on a canyon map against other alliances. You capture buildings scattered across the map by marching troops to them. Holding buildings generates points over time. Enemy alliances attack your buildings while you attack theirs. It's 2 hours of real-time chaos - you need to be online, marching fast, and coordinating with your alliance to hold key positions. Similar to Alliance Showdown but in a canyon terrain.

tips: Requires online participation
Coordinate with alliance
Territory control = ongoing rewards

canyon_clash.notes: Good alliance event. Requires coordination and online presence.

flame_and_fang.name: Flame and Fang
flame_and_fang.description: PvE event: Hunt Firebeasts, complete Intel Missions, earn Crystallite Cores for Fire Crystals and speedups.
flame_and_fang.gameplay: Firebeasts appear on the map! Hunt them solo with your exploration heroes for Crystallite Cores. Also complete Intel Missions (refresh 3x daily) for more cores. Spend your cores in the event shop on Fire Crystals, speedups, or resources. The trick is saving yesterday's Intel missions and claiming them after the event starts for bonus cores. Spend ALL cores before event ends or they turn into worthless meat!

timeline.action: Complete missions but DO NOT CLAIM
CLAIM saved missions + complete new refresh

spending_priority.warning: Unspent cores convert to 10K Meat each - total waste!

tips: DAY BEFORE: At 16:00, complete Intel missions but DON'T CLAIM
This trick gives you 16 extra cores (184 vs 168)
Intel missions only last 15 hours - don't miss refreshes
Spend ALL cores before event ends - leftover = wasted as Meat
Prioritize Fire Crystals over everything else

flame_and_fang.notes: Great F2P event. Use the pre-event trick for 16 extra cores. NEVER leave cores unspent.

foundry_battle.name: Foundry Battle
foundry_battle.gameplay: Alliances fight over control of the Foundry building on the map. You send troops to capture and hold buildings on a battlefield. Holding buildings generates points. Enemy alliances try to take them from you. The alliance controlling the Foundry at the end gets crafting bonuses. Quick 1-hour event - you need to be online and sending marches to capture/defend.

tips: Short event - must be online
Foundry control = crafting bonuses

foundry_battle.notes: Quick event. Worth doing if online.

hero_rally.name: Hero Rally
hero_rally.description: Accumulate points from various activities for hero shards.
hero_rally.gameplay: A week-long event featuring a specific hero. You earn points through normal gameplay activities - completing buildings, training troops, using speedups, etc. Reaching point milestones rewards you with the featured hero's shards. It's basically a bonus for playing the game normally, with extra rewards if you spend. Check if the featured hero is actually worth building before going hard on this event.

tips: Check if featured hero is worth it
Points come from normal gameplay
Spending accelerates progress

hero_rally.notes: Good way to get specific heroes. Value depends on featured hero.

speedups.tip: Hall of Chiefs is primary. SvS Prep Day 1, 2, and 5 ONLY - Days 3 & 4 give NO speedup points!

fire_crystals.tip: Save ALL Fire Crystals for SvS Prep Day 1. 2,000 points per FC.

hero_shards.tip: Save specific hero shards for SvS Prep Day 2. General shards DON'T count!

lucky_wheel_tickets.tip: Save tickets for SvS Prep Day 2. 8,000 points per spin.

wild_marks.tip: Save Wild Marks for SvS Prep Day 3. Advanced = 15,000 pts each.

mithril.tip: NEVER use Mithril outside SvS Prep Day 4. 40,000 points per unit!

essence_stones.tip: Save Essence Stones for SvS Prep Day 4.

stamina.tip: Day 3 Polar Terror rallies need stamina. Max before Battle Phase.

flames.tip: NEVER spend flames outside Flame Lotto. Save every single one.

gems.tip: Save gems for Lucky Wheel spins on S+ tier heroes only.

crafting_materials.tip: Don't craft gear outside of Artisan's Trove event.

svs_prep_resource_calendar.description: What to save for each SvS Prep day

day_4.note: Speedups help train faster but give ZERO points - save them for Day 5
